data.enText: feelings of disapproval that people have about particular illnesses or ways of behaving

data.chText: 离婚不再是什么丢脸的事。
data.enText: There is no longer any stigma attached to being divorced.
the part in the middle of a flower where pollen is received

tr: a skin lesion that is a diagnostic sign of some disease
an external tracheal aperture in a terrestrial arthropod
a symbol of disgrace or infamy
example: And the Lord set a mark upon Cain"--Genesi

tr: the apical end of the style where deposited pollen enters the pistil

value.def: If something has a stigma attached to it, people think it is something to be ashamed of.

example.ex: There is a strong argument for remaining an unmarried mother. There's no stigma attached any more...
example.tran: 有强有力的理由来支持未婚妈妈。这再也不是什么丢脸的事了。

example.ex: There is very little stigma attached to crime and criminals.
example.tran: 人们几乎都不把犯罪和罪犯视为一种耻辱。

value.def: The stigma of a flower is the top of the centre part which takes in pollen.

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 无 + stigma 标志；斑点 + tic 有…性质的，属于…的，具有…的 → 聚不到一个点 → 散光的
stigm 标志；斑点 + atize → 给〔别人〕加污点 → 玷污
